title: The Crocodile Hunter is dead.
content:
[url=http://www.news.com.au/couriermail/story/0,23739,20349534-952,00.html]www.news.com.au/couriermail/story/0,23739,20349534-952,00.html[/url]

[quote]Quote:[hr]THE Crocodile Man, Steve Irwin, is dead.

He was killed in a freak accident in Cairns, police sources said.

It is understood he was killed by a sting-ray barb that went through his chest.

He was swimming off the Low Isles at Port Douglas filming an underwater documentary and that's when it occured.

Ambulance officers confirmed they attended a reef fatality this morning at Batt Reef off Port Douglas.

It is understood Mr Irwin was killed around midday, Eastern Australian time.

It is understood he was killed instantly.

A source said Mr Irwin was already dead when his body was brought onto the Isle.

A source said Mr Irwin's body was being airlifted to Cairns Hospital in North Queensland for formal identification.[hr][/quote]

[quote]Quote:[hr]HE dealt daily with all manner of dangerous creatures ... giant crocodiles, poisonous snakes, komodo dragons ... but it was a less obvious hazard that claimed the life of Steve Irwin.

Irwin had taken calculated risks with all sorts of wildlife for decades, relying on his knowledge of animal behaviour and personal experience to beat the odds.

For someone who spent so much time around killer animals, Irwin seemed to leave a charmed life.

So his demise was all the more shocking because it apparently involved a stingray, an animal regarded as dangerous but not as a killer.

It is understood that Irwin was swimming off the Low Isles off Port Douglas filming a documentary, a task Irwin has carried out on countless occasions.

Yet this time, Irwin, ever so careful around danger, was taken unawares when, apparently, a sting ray he was filming struck out with its tail, the venomous barbs fatally embedding in his chest.

The death brought to an end a career that began with his father's Sunshine Coast theme park and developed into an international empire in which Irwinwas a globally recognised brand.

Working with his American-born wife Terri, and later, children his Bindi and Bob, the Irwin phenomenon continued to grow.

He was as recognised in the USA as he was here, and was one of the best-known Australians on the planet.[hr][/quote]------------------
[url=http://www.szevvy.net]www.szevvy.net[/url], for all your Wombat needs. You know you want to.
A member of the LevelLord fan club.

title: Re: The Crocodile Hunter is dead.
content:

And Spleen never!

title: Re: The Crocodile Hunter is dead.
content:
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] Rest in peace..

Yeah, it's sad news and quite a surprise. These stingrays are deadly! I didn't know they could be so dangerous.

And yeah, it was pretty strange death -- seems almost destined, as LL said..3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: The Crocodile Hunter is dead.
content: Who's gonna take his place? I mean, he is the president of Australia or something, right?[center]TOUGH GUYS DON'T FOLLOW FADS[/center]

title: Re: The Crocodile Hunter is dead.
content:
Wow, thats a shame. Wikipedia said he's only the third person recorded to have been killed by a stingray in Australian history.

It's kinda creepy, because I just watched the shadowlands 3 animation today which had the crocodile hunter parody. I then went to wikipedia, and saw that he died today.

title: Re: The Crocodile Hunter is dead.
content:
Stabbed through the heart with a poisonous tail. At least the death wasn't too painful for him, because it went quick, and no one stands a chance with poison so close to the heart.

I never really knew much about the guy, but he sounded adventurous. Very. Farewell then...

I can't help but think about Up Skit Creek 2 now.____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.
